page.title: 04Old Down Inn, Emborough
page.content: 1740AD is carved into the wall of The Old Down Inn situated on the Wells to Bath road at its junction with the A37. It is a reminder of its status in the stage coach ara when it was very important to the Royal Mail, being first a posting house and later a Receiving Office. The stables remain behind the Inn, and although having been totally rebuilt after being gutted by fire in 1885, still has the same exterior as in the eighteenth century. The Inn is no longe so prominent since the path of the A3139 was slightly deviated to make the junction safer but it still maintains old traditions and offers meals, snacks and overnight, accomodation to the motorists who have replaced the mailcoach passengers.
